intro: Airyantha schweinfurthii subsp. schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Schweinfurth's airyantha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. This subspecies is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained environments.
